title: Celebrity Race Winners: Roman and Harleymoon Win Big Adventure
summary: Roman Kemp and his sister Harleymoon won a fun TV show called Celebrity Race Across the World. They raced with other teams through Central America for 33 days, traveling 5,900 kilometers without phones or planes. Each person had only £950 to spend. In the final episode, they went from Medellín to the Guajira Peninsula in Colombia. Roman and Harleymoon finished first, just two minutes before Molly Rainford and Tyler West. Anita Rani and her dad Bal came third, and Dylan Llewellyn and his mum Jackie stopped earlier because they ran out of money. The show is popular, with about six million people watching. Roman is a TV host, and Harleymoon is a singer. They said the race was very exciting and emotional.

questions.question: Why did Dylan and Jackie leave the race early?

background_read: Celebrity Race Across the World is a BBC TV show where famous people travel through countries without modern help like phones or planes. They have a limited budget and race to checkpoints. It tests their skills and teamwork. The show is fun to watch because it shows real adventures and emotions. This article talks about the winners of the latest series, Roman Kemp and his sister Harleymoon, and how they beat other teams in Central America.
Article_Structure: WHO: Roman Kemp and his sister Harleymoon, along with other celebrity teams like Molly Rainford and Tyler West, Anita Rani and Bal, and Dylan Llewellyn and Jackie.
WHAT: They won the Celebrity Race Across the World by reaching the final checkpoint first after a 33-day race through Central America without phones or planes.
WHERE: The race happened in Central America, including countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Colombia, with the final stage from Medellín to the Guajira Peninsula.
WHY: To have an exciting adventure and win the race, testing their ability to travel on a budget and without modern technology.

perspectives.description: Roman and Harleymoon felt very excited and emotional about winning the race after a tough journey.
